column2: We seek an experienced, talented, and focused administrator to join our dynamic back office team providing support activities to enable the delivery of installation, maintenance, and product support services for electrical utility assets across the UK          Job Context            You will work as part of a team supporting a highly skilled Engineering division covering all aspects of HV services to our clients and customers      As part of our team, you will get to both support your peers in the delivery of engineering services, new enquiries, order processing through to invoice & product spares      We strive forwards as a team advancing our technical skills, knowledge, and competencies together, whilst ensuring a flexible work life balance is worked into our ethos      The ideal candidate will have a background in providing administrative support and data processing          Job Dimensions          You will be working with a team of skilled project, delivery and administrative staff based in UK supporting a team of LV/HV Engineers, SAP s, managers and supporting staff across all aspects of the HV industry.      The core hours are 08:30 to 17:30 IST Monday to Friday, depending on operational workload additional hours may be required.          Key Accountabilities          Ensure scheduling records are up to date with all job details and references      Provide data analysis on job management, customers and suppliers as required      Reviewing, validating and inputting timesheet data to facilitate job costing reports      Maintain records to allow KPI reporting      Cross check invoices to Purchase Orders and receipt costs accordingly      Consume parts following site visits using Microsoft Dynamics 365.      Complete post delivery job review to ensure all items closed out and job costing complete      Support interdepartmental recharges maintaining records to be processed.      Support all areas of the department in relation to office systems, bookings, POs, equipment hire, delivery      dates, equipment hire etc.      Ensure Service Level Agreements are managed and supported in line with T&Cs.      Ensure a strong working relationship with other departments across Lucy Electric.      Ensure that all work is carried out in accordance with the standards, policies and procedures of Lucy Electric and its customers.      Liaise closely with Team Supervisors and Manager to understand and manage priorities.      Attend training and continuous development opportunities as required.          Qualifications, Experience & Skills          Experience of delivering efficient and effective services to internal and external customers.      Good interpersonal skills.      Excellent written English      Experience in managing calls and centralized customer support e-mail.      Experience in controlling data to report on figures and KPIs.      Experience of document and process management.      Computer literate skilled in MS outlook and Excel, D365, CRM systems.          Desirable:          Experience in managing customer and key accounts.      Knowledge of finance, and ability to manage job costing and forecast figures.      A qualification in business, management, project management.      Knowledge of ISO9001, 14001 or 18001 (45001)          Behavioural Competencies:          Good interpersonal skills with a pleasant and can-do attitude.      Highly organised and tidy.      Must have a positive and confident approach to tasks.      Good problem-solving skills.      Able to work independently, within a team and taking the lead when required

column2: Role & responsibilities     The role holder is responsible to manage various reporting requirements like Business performance, KPIs, Performance Management. To provide insights within organisation across all hierarchy levels right from ExCO to ground level staff and to distribution spread across Bank Staff, Business partners. This role requires maintenance of existing reporting application Saral which is built on SQL & Pentaho. Also person is required to build / automate new dashboards on this reporting application, hence extensive knowledge of various databases & ETL tool is required. Objective of the role is to reduce execution time and associated risk, by automating existing manual reports and to create process and control over various aspects of business intelligence framework, Reporting automation platforms, data dictionary, requirement documents and traceability documents. Use MS Excel, MS Access, PL/SQL, ETL, OLTP System, Macro scripting, BI tools, data warehouse, and all available resources to create & automate reports Automation of new reports and continuous tuning / enhancement of already automated reports for improvement opportunities.   Ensure that outputs match with the existing manual reports however with an objective of reducing manual efforts & execution time for reports streamlining and efficiency. Gather requirements from in-house teams by understanding existing reporting process and creating automated reports for same. Handling end to end delivery from Requirement understanding, Development, SIT/Dev testing before releasing for Business UAT, UAT testing support & production Go Live  Ensure proper Technical documentation & SOP for business usage for future references. Should have hands on experience of SQL & ETL tools for faster learning experience and delivery Knowledge of insurance industry is MUST to have quick hand holding. Monitoring various sales KPI such as issuance target achievement, login, pipeline cases, commission earned, new business and renewal business, branch & people activation and productivity, etc to the distribution partners and business development teams Providing qualitative and timely information to decision makers on all of the aforesaid parameters in form of various dashboards, such as HO business update (automated), early claims dashboard, surrender payout monitoring, etc responsible for publishing sales metrics in terms of timely and accurate incentive calculation for 5000+ sales staff on monthly basis approved sales incentive scheme as a part of SFM (Sales Force Management) facilitate cross functional support for launching new products, new channel, business development, Regulatory / IRDAI inspection, queries etc by - providing analytical and data oriented support equipping CxO with analytical insights for them to make strategic & tactical decisions Responsible for assessing Information needs and underline the process level definitions for Distribution, Products and Marketing departments. Set measurable tracking mechanism and suggest actionable MIS & Dashboards for performance assessment Identification of potential risk items, which may lead to data inconsistency & suggest mitigation plan. Define & revise key measures used across organization and collaborate for documentation design & deploy new reports and tracking dashboards, within least possible turn around Should have hands on experience in all or most of below mentioned tools; Knowledge of insurance industry will be an added advantage Skills Required: Must Have :  PL/SQL & Query knowledge - hands on OLTP systems Knowledge of RDBMS Understanding of ETL Tools Advanced Excel Good to have  API Creations  Angular, Node Js, Java script    Thanks, Subhash Nautiyal? HR Team E-mail:?subhash.nautiyal @canarahsbclife.in

column2: The Specialist BI Administrator is responsible for the maintenance, performance tuning, security, and overall administration of the organizations SAP Enterprise Data Warehouse. You will work closely with data engineers, database administrators, and other IT professionals to ensure the EDWs stability, scalability, and availability.                   System Administration                   Oversee the day-to-day operations of the EDW, including system monitoring, backup and recovery, and performance tuning.                   Data Modeling                   Maintain data models, schemas, and structures within the Enterprise Data Warehouse to ensure efficient storage and retrieval of data.                   ETL Development                   Develop, test, and maintain Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes to move and transform data from source systems into the data warehouse.                   Data Quality Assurance                 Implement data quality checks, validation rules, and data profiling techniques to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data.                 Performance Optimization                 Monitor and optimize EDW performance to ensure efficient data retrieval and reporting.                 Documentation                 Maintain comprehensive documentation of data models, ETL processes, and data lineage for auditing and reference purposes.                 Report and Dashboard Development                 Collaborate with business analysts and data visualization experts to create reports and dashboards that enable data-driven decision-making.                 Security and Compliance                 Ensure data security and compliance with relevant data protection regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA) and company policies.                 Data Governance                 Implement and enforce data governance practices to maintain data quality, lineage, and metadata.                 Troubleshooting                 Investigate and resolve data-related issues and provide support to end-users.                   Business Partnering                   Builds strong collaborative relationships with multiple business stakeholders, managing expectations, providing a clear point of contact within IT for each business stakeholder and acting as a bridge between IT and the business for technology business initiatives.                   Collaborates with the Implementation Partner (Project Manager) reporting on project status, issues and changes and working to ensure project requirements are well understood, documented, and approved by all stakeholders.                   Essential Functions of the Role**:                   Flexibility in work schedule, off-hours for project implementation.                      Travel via plane or automobile both locally and internationally                    Work Experience Requirements                         Number of Overall Years Necessary: 5-8                                 A minimum of 3 years of experience in SAP BI 7                                 A minimum or 3     years of experience business process analysis and design                         Education Requirements                         BS/BA , or equivalent business experience in a business related discipline                          Specialized Skills/Technical Knowledge:                       Possesses deep enterprise-wide application knowledge in the designated business function. Application knowledge includes configuration of business processes, key integration points between modules, related master data, and transactional execution.                              Maintains current knowledge of the business trends and technology developments and applies this knowledge to meet the business challenges.                               Strong expertise in desktop applications essential to the position including Visio for process flow diagrams, Excel and/or Access for large scale data analysis.                                 Knowledge of business requirements elicitation techniques, such as use cases, prototyping, questionnaires, etc. used in the business analysis discipline. Applies appropriate requirements gathering approach based upon the situation and audience.                                 Business partnering skills to be able to align business needs to technology solutions to deliver business value.                                 Strong analytical skills to identify business needs, formulate viable alternative solutions, and present the business/technical impact of the solutions.                                 Strong verbal communication skills including the ability to understand oral descriptions of complex business processes and technical content. Converses with business users using common business vocabulary, avoiding technical jargon. Takes measures to test common understanding including paraphrasing and slowing their speech pattern.                                 Strong written communication skills including the ability to document complex business processes and technical content using common business terminology. Uses visual aids like process flows or decision tables to supplement verbal explanations.
column11: Business services, Data analysis, Compliance, Business analysis, Data modeling, data security, HIPAA, Data quality, Visio, SAP BI

column1: S&C Global Network - AI - Telecom Analytics - Analyst
column2: Entity :- Accenture Strategy & Consulting Team :- Global Network - Data & AI Practice :- Comms & Media - Telecom Title :- Level 11 Ind & Func AI Decision Science Analyst Job location :- Bangalore/Gurgaon/Hyderabad/Mumbai About Global Network Data & AI :- Accenture Strategy & Consulting Global Network - Data & AI practice help our clients grow their business in entirely new ways. Analytics enables our clients to achieve high performance through insights from data - insights that inform better decisions and strengthen customer relationships. From strategy to execution, Accenture works with organizations to develop analytic capabilities - from accessing and reporting on data to predictive modelling - to outperform the competition About Comms & Media practice: Comms & Media (C&M) is one of the Industry Practices within Accenture's S&C Global Network team. It focuses in serving clients across specific Industries Communications, Media & Entertainment. Communications Focuses primarily on industries related with telecommunications and information & communication technology (ICT). This team serves most of the world's leading wireline, wireless, cable and satellite communications and service providers Media & Entertainment Focuses on industries like broadcast, entertainment, print and publishing Globally, Accenture Comms & Media practice works to develop value growth strategies for its clients and infuse AI & GenAI to help deliver top their business imperatives i.e., revenue growth & cost reduction. From multi-year Data & AI transformation projects to shorter more agile engagements, we have a rapidly expanding portfolio of hyper-growth clients and an increasing footprint with next-gen solutions and industry practices. Responsibilities/Authorities Data science Analyst is responsible to help the clients with designing & delivering AI solutions. He/she should be strong in Telco domain, AI fundamentals and should have good hands-on experience working with the following: Ability to work with large data sets and present conclusions to key stakeholders; Data management using SQL. Propose solutions to the client based on gap analysis for the existing Telco platforms that can generate long term & sustainable value to the client. Gather business requirements from client stakeholders via interactions like interviews and workshops with all stakeholders Track down and read all previous information on the problem or issue in question. Explore obvious and known avenues thoroughly. Ask a series of probing questions to get to the root of a problem. Ability to understand the as-is process; understand issues with the processes which can be resolved either through Data & AI or process solutions and design detail level to-be state Understand customer needs and identify/translate them to business requirements (business requirement definition), business process flows and functional requirements and be able to inform the best approach to the problem. Adopt a clear and systematic approach to complex issues (i.e. A leads to B leads to C). Analyze relationships between several parts of a problem or situation. Anticipate obstacles and identify a critical path for a project. Independently able to deliver products and services that empower clients to implement effective solutions. Makes specific changes and improvements to processes or own work to achieve more. Work with other team members and make deliberate efforts to keep others up to date. Establish a consistent and collaborative presence with clients and act as the primary point of contact for assigned clients; escalate, track, and solve client issues. Partner with clients to understand end clients' business goals, marketing objectives, and competitive constraints. Storytelling Crunch the data & numbers to craft a story to be presented to senior client stakeholders.

column1: Business Supervisory - Surveillance and BSO Data/Admin support
column2: Job Title: Business Supervisory - Surveillance and BSO Data/Admin support Analyst/Associate Role Description: Regulatory Control is responsible for establishing and maintaining control frameworks designed to manage regulatory, monitoring, surveillance, employee compliance, transaction monitoring and client screening. Work includes: Implementing the global or regional strategy to establish and maintain the control frameworks designed to manage regulatory, monitoring, surveillance, employee compliance, transaction monitoring and client screening Ensuring operational discipline combined with regulatory risk awareness & investigative skills and warrants that workflows are governed by established policies, clearly defined processes, and escalation points Controls, Testing & Assurance (CT&A), which tests effectiveness of Key Controls and Risk Management Frameworks related to Compliance and Financial Crime Risk Types Providing Quality Assurance (QA)/Monitoring for certain financial crime risk related processes Your key responsibilities  Create & publish Daily, Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly surveillance reports and the review of Wealth Management accounts and transactions, as part of 1st Line of Defense reviews. Review the Brokerage and WM account activity including trades, journals, portfolio holdings, solicitations, etc. Review of documentation by client facing partners describing their interactions with clients and the resulting transactions under the Reg BI rule Administrative support of trading system ad hoc reporting and alert review in support of trade and account surveillance Assist branch management with special regulatory ad hoc projects Brainstorm on enhancing the existing projects/processes from an RPA perspective Support the Marketing Review Group facilitation of Forms & Agreements for Wealth Management Supporting the GBSA/Volcker administrative tasks and reporting. Assist in any added projects/process Your skills and experience Skills Youll Need 3-4 years of Regulatory and Brokerage Trade Surveillance experience, preferably for the Wealth Management business Expertise in MS Excel, MS Access, data manipulation Strong understanding of regulatory rules, analytical ability to interpret surveillance reports, and insight to propose new processes and reports Prior experience with regulatory, audit, and compliance functions is preferred Experience with PM1, SunGard/FIS Protegent Surveillance tool and SunGard front-end systems such as NetX360 is a plus Skills That Will Help You Excel Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken Expertise in MS Excel MS Access development is a plus SharePoint experience is also a plus Critical thinking Self-Motivated Detail Oriented Ability to stay on track to strict reporting schedules and deadlines Independent decision making skills with understanding of when to escalate Adobe experience a plus Excellent team player with good communication and interpersonal skills How we'll support you Training and development to help you excel in your career Coaching and support from experts in your team A culture of continuous learning to aid progression A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs

column2: Skill required:  Pharmacovigilance Services - Pharmacovigilance & Drug Safety Surveillance Designation:  Pharmacovigilance Services Analyst Qualifications: Bachelor of Pharmacy/Master of Pharmacy  Years of Experience: 3 to 5 years  Language - Ability: Japanese - Intermediate  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Life Sciences R&D vertical. Our services span across the entire life sciences enterprise, from research laboratories, clinical trials support, and regulatory services, to pharmacovigilance and patient services solutions. Employees under this span will be a part of one of the sub-offerings - Clinical, Pharmacovigilance & Regulatory, helping the world's leading biopharma companies bring their vision to life - enabling them to improve outcomes by converging around the patient, connecting scientific expertise with unique insights into the patient experience.Management of the Affiliate Mailbox, reconciliation of reports per process, and performance of all written follow-up attempts to include both Serious and Non-serious cases.In this role, you will be expected to create and manage case identification, data entry, MedDRA coding, case processing, submission, and follow-ups for ICSRs in the safety database as per client guidelines and applicable global regulatory requirements. What are we looking for? Ability to perform under pressure Adaptable and flexible Ability to work well in a team Prioritization of workload Commitment to quality  Certifications: JLPT/Japanese Language Proficiency Test - N3 - JEES; JLPT/Japanese Language Proficiency Test - N2 - JEES  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of lower-complexity problems Your day to day interaction is with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors In this role you may have limited exposure with clients and/or Accenture management You will be given moderate level instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instructions on new assignments The decisions you make impact your own work and may impact the work of others You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a focused scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification Bachelor of Pharmacy,Master of Pharmacy

column2: General Information  Ref #: 20240038568 Travel Amount Required: None Job Type: Regular-Full Time Location: Noida - India - India Company Overview  Here at UKG, our purpose is people. Our HR, payroll, and workforce management solutions help organizations unlock happier outcomes for all. And our U Krewers, who build those solutions and support our business, are talented, collaborative, and innovative problem-solvers. We strive to create a culture of belonging and an employee experience that empowers our people both at work and at home. Our benefits show that we care about the whole you, from adoption and surrogacy assistance to tuition reimbursement and wellness programs. Our employee resource groups provide a welcoming place to land, learn, and connect with those who share your passions and interests. What are you waiting for? Learn more at #WeAreUKG Description & Qualifications  Description Do you have a passion for data and using it to drive positive change? Are you excited about leveraging the power of AI to unlock valuable insights? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you! Our Enterprise IT Support team is looking for a talented Digital Employee Experience(DEX) Analyst to join our ranks and help us optimize our operations and better serve our internal employees. You will be responsible for diving deep into various data sources, including hardware asset management, incident and request data, and laptop management tools. This position is responsible for leveraging advanced analytical techniques, technical expertise, and strategic insights to drive continuous improvement, innovation, and operational excellence across desktop environments. By analyzing this information, you will generate reports, presentations, and actionable insights that will inform strategic decision-making and improve our overall efficiency. Key Responsibilities: 1.Data Acquisition and Analysis: Employ advanced analytical methodologies and tools to meticulously gather, process, and dissect desktop-related data. Utilize techniques such as data mining, statistical analysis, and machine learning algorithms to extract meaningful insights from diverse data sources, including system logs, configuration files, and user interactions. 2.Solution Formulation and Implementation: Develop data-driven solutions and actionable recommendations to address identified desktop-related challenges and opportunities. Leverage expertise in software engineering, systems architecture, and deployment methodologies to design and implement innovative solutions that enhance desktop performance, reliability, and user experience. 3.Data Visualization and Reporting: Create comprehensive visualizations, dashboards, and reports to effectively communicate analytical findings and insights to stakeholders. Utilize data visualization libraries and tools to craft interactive visualizations that facilitate data-driven decision-making and enhance situational awareness across the organization. 4.Emerging Technology Evaluation and Adoption: Evaluate emerging desktop technologies, tools, and trends to assess their potential impact, feasibility, and suitability for adoption within the organization. Conduct proof-of-concept trials, pilot deployments, and technology assessments to validate the effectiveness and viability of new technologies before enterprise-wide implementation. 5.Anomaly Detection and Root Cause Analysis: Employ sophisticated anomaly detection algorithms and root cause analysis techniques to identify aberrations, deviations, and potential issues within desktop environments. Employing statistical methods and anomaly detection models to proactively pinpoint anomalies and investigate underlying causes to prevent disruptions and optimize system performance. 6.Process Automation and Orchestration: Automate repetitive tasks and streamline desktop management processes through the development of scripts, workflows, and automation pipelines. Leverage scripting languages, configuration management tools, and orchestration frameworks to automate provisioning, configuration, and maintenance tasks, thereby reducing manual effort and enhancing operational efficiency. 7.Continuous Improvement and Innovation: Proactively identify opportunities for process improvement, technological advancement, and innovation within the desktop engineering domain. Stay abreast of emerging technologies, research trends, and industry developments to drive continuous improvement initiatives and foster a culture of innovation within the team. 8.Customer-Centric Service Delivery: Provide exceptional customer service and technical support to end-users, addressing their desktop-related queries, issues, and requests promptly and effectively. Foster positive relationships with users, understand their unique requirements and preferences, and strive to deliver tailored solutions that exceed their expectations and enhance their overall satisfaction. 9.CMDB- Change Management and Configuration Control: Implement robust change management processes and configuration control mechanisms to manage changes to desktop configurations, software deployments, and infrastructure modifications. Utilize version control systems, change tracking tools, and configuration management databases (CMDBs) to maintain a comprehensive inventory of desktop assets and track configuration changes accurately. 10.Performance Benchmarking and Comparative Analysis: Benchmark desktop performance metrics against industry standards, benchmarks, and peer organizations to assess performance competitiveness and identify areas for improvement. Conduct comparative analysis studies to evaluate the effectiveness of desktop technologies, solutions, and practices relative to industry peers and competitors.  Qualifications - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Technology, or related field. - 6+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in an IT support environment or desktop engineering, or related roles. - Strong proficiency in data analysis, scripting, and automation. - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a demonstrated ability to translate data into actionable insights. - Expertise in desktop technologies, operating systems, and software applications. - Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Power BI and Excel - Experience with AI and machine learning techniques is a plus. - Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills. - Ability to work independently and as part of a team - Certifications such as ITIL, CompTIA A+, or Microsoft Certified
column11: Data analysis, application software, data mining, asset management, power bi, machine learning, root cause analysis, artificial intelligence, desktop, system architecture, analysis tools, software engineering, data acquisition, statistics

column2: We seek an experienced, talented, and focused administrator to join our dynamic back office team providing support activities to enable the delivery of installation, maintenance, and product support services for electrical utility assets across the UK.           Job Context         You will work as part of a team supporting a highly skilled Engineering division covering all aspects of HV services to our clients and customers.      As part of our team, you will get to both support your peers in the delivery of engineering services, new enquiries, order processing through to invoice product spares.      We strive forwards as a team advancing our technical skills, knowledge, and competencies together, whilst ensuring a flexible work life balance is worked into our ethos.     The ideal candidate will have a background in providing administrative support and data processing.         Job Dimensions       You will be working with a team of skilled project, delivery and administrative staff based in UK supporting a team of LV/HV Engineers, SAPs, managers and supporting staff across all aspects of the HV industry.     The core hours are 08:30 to 17:30 IST Monday to Friday, depending on operational workload additional hours may be required.           Key Accountabilities         Ensure scheduling records are up to date with all job details and references     Provide data analysis on job management, customers and suppliers as required     Reviewing, validating and inputting timesheet data to facilitate job costing reports     Maintain records to allow KPI reporting     Cross check invoices to Purchase Orders and receipt costs accordingly     Consume parts following site visits using Microsoft Dynamics 365.     Complete post delivery job review to ensure all items closed out and job costing complete     Support interdepartmental recharges maintaining records to be processed.     Support all areas of the department in relation to office systems, bookings, POs, equipment hire, delivery     dates, equipment hire etc     Ensure Service Level Agreements are managed and supported in line with TCs.     Ensure a strong working relationship with other departments across Lucy Electric.     Ensure that all work is carried out in accordance with the standards, policies and procedures of Lucy Electric and its customers.     Liaise closely with Team Supervisors and Manager to understand and manage priorities.     Attend training and continuous development opportunities as required.         Qualifications, Experience Skills         Experience of delivering efficient and effective services to internal and external customers.     Good interpersonal skills.     Excellent written English     Experience in managing calls and centralized customer support e-mail.     Experience in controlling data to report on figures and KPIs.     Experience of document and process management.     Computer literate skilled in MS outlook and Excel, D365, CRM systems.         Desirable:         Experience in managing customer and key accounts.     Knowledge of finance, and ability to manage job costing and forecast figures.     A qualification in business, management, project management.     Knowledge of ISO9001, 14001 or 18001 (45001)         Behavioural Competencies:         Good interpersonal skills with a pleasant and can-do attitude.     Highly organised and tidy.     Must have a positive and confident approach to tasks.     Good problem-solving skills.     Able to work independently, within a team and taking the lead when required
